summary: Give people things until they become your friends and love you and want to follow you around. Customisable! Has support for Immersive Speechcraft!
descriptionHtml:
[center][size=3][b]Requires:[/b] Official DLC, SKSE
[b]Recommended:[/b] [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/63874/?]Immersive Speechcraft[/url], [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/74568/?]Relationship Dialogue Overhaul[/url][/size][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/74568/?]
[/url]
[youtube]iUTY8n-d6Rc[/youtube][/center]

[size=3]A customisable system for giving NPCs gifts, designed as a personal replacement for the gift option in Immersive Speechcraft (patch included). Dialogue included for all non-unique voiced characters, including children and Solstheim residents.

[b]Optional features:[/b]
[/size][list]
[*][size=3]Improve your Speech skill[/size]
[*][size=3]Gradually improve your relationships[/size]
[*][size=3]Find out the gifts people like the most[/size]
[*][size=3]Make people like you so much they either want to marry you or follow you to their deaths[/size]
[*][size=3]Gain the Gift of Charity[/size]
[*][size=3]Have people equip the things you give them[/size]
[*][size=3]Limit the total number of gifts you can give out over a certain time period[/size]
[/list]
[size=3][b]Caveats:[/b]
[/size][list]
[*][size=3]Using the Immersive Speechcraft patch won't let you gift kids or people with the Dragonborn voices[/size]
[*][size=3]Giving money to beggars or drinks to drunks is unchanged, and will still result in a greater increase in relationship than gift giving might in this mod.[/size]
[*][size=3]A number of vanilla quests will set an NPC's relationship rank without checking what it already is. A character you've raised to ally rank through gift giving may be reduced to friend rank upon completing a quest for them.[/size]
[*][size=3]This mod is designed to accept one item as a gift. If you give away a stack or are able to give away multiple things due to script lag, etc., the extra things will be taken but have no additional effects.[/size]
[*][size=3]Randomisation of NPC gift preferences could probably better. Currently based on Skyrim's unused gift filters. Pretty much everyone will respond favourably to food.[/size]
[/list]
author: hugs
